results.content:
Good things: The lessons are easy to follow, clear and concise.
Bad things: 
During the second part of the course, the video quality is so awful you cannot read the code on the screen. 
SASS Resources in part two are not fully complete, so you cannot reverse-engineer or compare code.
Course also assumes in-depth knowledge of VS Code, and asks you to manually alter the VS Code source code. If you do not pay very close attention to the screen, this is an easy way to break things - any explanation or warning would be very useful.

response.content:
Hi Lila, thank you for your review but I think its kind of unfair because as I explained the video quality can be set from the bottom right courser of the screen and if your buffer speed (internet speed) drops then the video quality also drops. Pls take in to consideration that I am not responsible for Udemy`s streaming quality. And also pls take in to consideration that I uploaded 1080p videos to udemy, with over 30 hovers of content and it took me 5 months to make this course. In conclusions I would kindly ask you to reconsider your review because a 2 start review will push my course down and no-one will be able to se it on the platform.

Kinde regards, 
Norbert.

results.content: This is a well organized and fully comprehensible hobby study. I recommend it to everyone getting into new stuff. Great work! keep it up! and thank you!

results.content:
The teacher is very calm and explains averting in a precise meaner, and the templates are awesome. But I want moooooreee ! 

The components are the best part of this course :D

results.content: The idea of creating your own framework is very cool, Norbert did a great job. I had some minor problems with the files, but at my request they were immediately resolved.

results.content: The course has a solid structure with good explanation. Go for the first parts as well, as this is, as title implies, the advanced stuff. Well done, keep putting up new content!
